cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 miles SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest, expected to turn west-northwest Friday and northwest by early Saturday, approaching the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the mouth of the Mississippi River westward to Cameron, LA; Tropical Storm Watch from the mouth of the Mississippi River northward to the mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Watch from the mouth of the Pearl River westward to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast, mainly southeastern Louisiana and adjacent coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible late Friday through Saturday with a 29% chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely sustained winds 20–30 mph with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge impacts expected for Port Freeport.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain, locally higher, Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
